channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024070339
item.description:
Report E-2024070339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Cari Mallett
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: the tanker was filled to capacity in order to get as much out of Amcor's tank as possible. Tanker has a capacity of 5350 gallons. On the paperwork it shows 5346 gallons was loaded. When material was brought to destinated facility to process the trailer dome was opened and a sample was taken to the lab. While the lab was analyzing the sample the dome of the trailer was laid down but not shut completely. The temperature outside was ~90F. The material in the tanker started to get hot and run out of the dome and onto the ground. 1 gallon of material leaked into secondary containment and was cleaned up in house. The cause of the spill was that the tanker was overfilled.

item.title: Report E-2024070341
item.description:
Report E-2024070341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO INTERMODAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that unknown amount of Washington Mills UN3077 Cryolite Synthetic Powder released from one (1) Gaylord bag. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched Hepaco to the site to assist with clean up. Hepaco responded and observed approximately 10-pounds of Cryolite released from the damaged plastic gaylord. The release impacted a 10’X23’ area on the trailer floor. No drains or soil were impacted. Hepaco recovered the Cryolite. Hepaco unloaded the trailer, used simple green rags, wiped down the trailer, freighted, and reloaded the trailer. Hepaco created one 5-gallon poly drum of waste. Hepaco left the waste on-site with the XPO dock manager.

item.title: Report E-2024070187
item.description:
Report E-2024070187

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor and Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent absorbents and the damaged drum were overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
